summary: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.
synopsis: Memento chronicles two separate stories of Leonard, an ex-insurance investigator who can no longer build new memories, as he attempts to find the murderer of his wife, which is the last thing he remembers. One story line moves forward in time while the other tells the story backwards revealing more each time.
trivia: Memento was considered "culturally, historically or aesthetically" significant by the US Library of Congress and was selected for preservation in the National Film Registry in 2017. It is the Christopher Nolan's first movie to be preserved in National Film Registry. It was also the first non documentary film from the 2000's to be preserved.
